Camera ||  Cdrom ||  Color ||  Cursors ||  Display ||  Draw ||  Event ||  Examples ||  Font ||  Freetype ||  Gfxdraw ||  Image ||  Joystick ||  Key ||  Locals ||  Mask ||  Math ||  Midi ||  Mixer ||  Mouse ||  Movie ||  Music ||  Overlay ||  Pixelarray ||  Pixelcopy ||  Pygame ||  Rect ||  Scrap ||  Sndarray ||  Sprite ||  Surface ||  Surfarray ||  Tests ||  Time ||  Transform

  • pygame — the top level pygame package
    • pygame.Color — pygame object for color representations
      • Color.a — Gets or sets the alpha value of the Color.
      • Color.b — Gets or sets the blue value of the Color.
      • Color.cmy — Gets or sets the CMY representation of the Color.
      • Color.correct_gamma — Applies a certain gamma value to the Color.
      • Color.g — Gets or sets the green value of the Color.
      • Color.hsla — Gets or sets the HSLA representation of the Color.
      • Color.hsva — Gets or sets the HSVA representation of the Color.
      • Color.i1i2i3 — Gets or sets the I1I2I3 representation of the Color.
      • Color.normalize — Returns the normalized RGBA values of the Color.
      • Color.r — Gets or sets the red value of the Color.
      • Color.set_length — Set the number of elements in the Color to 1,2,3, or 4.
    • pygame.Overlay — pygame object for video overlay graphics
      • Overlay.display — set the overlay pixel data
      • Overlay.get_hardware — test if the Overlay is hardware accelerated
      • Overlay.set_location — control where the overlay is displayed
    • pygame.PixelArray — pygame object for direct pixel access of surfaces
      • PixelArray.compare — Compares the PixelArray with another one.
      • PixelArray.extract — Extracts the passed color from the PixelArray.
      • PixelArray.make_surface — Creates a new Surface from the current PixelArray.
      • PixelArray.replace — Replaces the passed color in the PixelArray with another one.
      • PixelArray.surface — Gets the Surface the PixelArray uses.
    • pygame.Rect — pygame object for storing rectangular coordinates
      • Rect.clamp — moves the rectangle inside another
      • Rect.clamp_ip — moves the rectangle inside another, in place
      • Rect.clip — crops a rectangle inside another
      • Rect.collidedict — test if one rectangle in a dictionary intersects
      • Rect.collidedictall — test if all rectangles in a dictionary intersect
      • Rect.collidelist — test if one rectangle in a list intersects
      • Rect.collidelistall — test if all rectangles in a list intersect
      • Rect.collidepoint — test if a point is inside a rectangle
      • Rect.colliderect — test if two rectangles overlap
      • Rect.contains — test if one rectangle is inside another
      • Rect.copy — copy the rectangle
      • Rect.fit — resize and move a rectangle with aspect ratio
      • Rect.inflate — grow or shrink the rectangle size
      • Rect.inflate_ip — grow or shrink the rectangle size, in place
      • Rect.move — moves the rectangle
      • Rect.move_ip — moves the rectangle, in place
      • Rect.normalize — correct negative sizes
      • Rect.union — joins two rectangles into one
      • Rect.union_ip — joins two rectangles into one, in place
      • Rect.unionall — the union of many rectangles
      • Rect.unionall_ip — the union of many rectangles, in place
    • pygame.Surface — pygame object for representing images
      • Surface.blit — draw one image onto another
      • Surface.convert — change the pixel format of an image
      • Surface.convert_alpha — change the pixel format of an image including per pixel alphas
      • Surface.copy — create a new copy of a Surface
      • Surface.fill — fill Surface with a solid color
      • Surface.get_abs_offset — find the absolute position of a child subsurface inside its top level parent
      • Surface.get_abs_parent — find the top level parent of a subsurface
      • Surface.get_alpha — get the current Surface transparency value
      • Surface.get_at — get the color value at a single pixel
      • Surface.get_at_mapped — get the mapped color value at a single pixel
      • Surface.get_bitsize — get the bit depth of the Surface pixel format
      • Surface.get_bounding_rect — find the smallest rect containing data
      • Surface.get_buffer — acquires a buffer object for the pixels of the Surface.
      • Surface.get_bytesize — get the bytes used per Surface pixel
      • Surface.get_clip — get the current clipping area of the Surface
      • Surface.get_colorkey — Get the current transparent colorkey
      • Surface.get_flags — get the additional flags used for the Surface
      • Surface.get_height — get the height of the Surface
      • Surface.get_locked — test if the Surface is current locked
      • Surface.get_locks — Gets the locks for the Surface
      • Surface.get_losses — the significant bits used to convert between a color and a mapped integer
      • Surface.get_masks — the bitmasks needed to convert between a color and a mapped integer
      • Surface.get_offset — find the position of a child subsurface inside a parent
      • Surface.get_palette — get the color index palette for an 8bit Surface
      • Surface.get_palette_at — get the color for a single entry in a palette
      • Surface.get_parent — find the parent of a subsurface
      • Surface.get_pitch — get the number of bytes used per Surface row
      • Surface.get_rect — get the rectangular area of the Surface
      • Surface.get_shifts — the bit shifts needed to convert between a color and a mapped integer
      • Surface.get_size — get the dimensions of the Surface
      • Surface.get_view — return a view of a surface's pixel data.
      • Surface.get_width — get the width of the Surface
      • Surface.lock — lock the Surface memory for pixel access
      • Surface.map_rgb — convert a color into a mapped color value
      • Surface.mustlock — test if the Surface requires locking
      • Surface.scroll — Shift the surface image in place
      • Surface.set_alpha — set the alpha value for the full Surface image
      • Surface.set_at — set the color value for a single pixel
      • Surface.set_clip — set the current clipping area of the Surface
      • Surface.set_colorkey — Set the transparent colorkey
      • Surface.set_masks — set the bitmasks needed to convert between a color and a mapped integer
      • Surface.set_palette — set the color palette for an 8bit Surface
      • Surface.set_palette_at — set the color for a single index in an 8bit Surface palette
      • Surface.set_shifts — sets the bit shifts needed to convert between a color and a mapped integer
      • Surface.subsurface — create a new surface that references its parent
      • Surface.unlock — unlock the Surface memory from pixel access
      • Surface.unmap_rgb — convert a mapped integer color value into a Color
    • pygame.camera — pygame module for camera use
      • pygame.camera.Camera — load a camera
        • Camera.get_controls — gets current values of user controls
        • Camera.get_image — captures an image as a Surface
        • Camera.get_raw — returns an unmodified image as a string
        • Camera.get_size — returns the dimensions of the images being recorded
        • Camera.query_image — checks if a frame is ready
        • Camera.set_controls — changes camera settings if supported by the camera
        • Camera.start — opens, initializes, and starts capturing
        • Camera.stop — stops, uninitializes, and closes the camera
      • pygame.camera.colorspace — Surface colorspace conversion
      • pygame.camera.list_cameras — returns a list of available cameras
    • pygame.cdrom — pygame module for audio cdrom control
      • pygame.cdrom.CD — class to manage a cdrom drive
        • CD.eject — eject or open the cdrom drive
        • CD.get_all — get all track information
        • CD.get_busy — true if the drive is playing audio
        • CD.get_current — the current audio playback position
        • CD.get_empty — False if a cdrom is in the drive
        • CD.get_id — the index of the cdrom drive
        • CD.get_init — true if this cd device initialized
        • CD.get_name — the system name of the cdrom drive
        • CD.get_numtracks — the number of tracks on the cdrom
        • CD.get_paused — true if the drive is paused
        • CD.get_track_audio — true if the cdrom track has audio data
        • CD.get_track_length — length of a cdrom track
        • CD.get_track_start — start time of a cdrom track
        • CD.init — initialize a cdrom drive for use
        • CD.pause — temporarily stop audio playback
        • CD.play — start playing audio
        • CD.quit — uninitialize a cdrom drive for use
        • CD.resume — unpause audio playback
        • CD.stop — stop audio playback
      • pygame.cdrom.get_count — number of cd drives on the system
      • pygame.cdrom.get_init — true if the cdrom module is initialized
      • pygame.cdrom.init — initialize the cdrom module
      • pygame.cdrom.quit — uninitialize the cdrom module
    • pygame.cursors — pygame module for cursor resources
      • pygame.cursors.compile — create binary cursor data from simple strings
      • pygame.cursors.load_xbm — load cursor data from an xbm file
    • pygame.display — pygame module to control the display window and screen
      • pygame.display.Info — Create a video display information object
      • pygame.display.flip — update the full display Surface to the screen
      • pygame.display.get_active — true when the display is active on the display
      • pygame.display.get_caption — get the current window caption
      • pygame.display.get_driver — get the name of the pygame display backend
      • pygame.display.get_init — true if the display module is initialized
      • pygame.display.get_surface — get a reference to the currently set display surface
      • pygame.display.get_wm_info — Get information about the current windowing system
      • pygame.display.gl_get_attribute — get the value for an opengl flag for the current display
      • pygame.display.gl_set_attribute — request an opengl display attribute for the display mode
      • pygame.display.iconify — iconify the display surface
      • pygame.display.init — initialize the display module
      • pygame.display.list_modes — get list of available fullscreen modes
      • pygame.display.mode_ok — pick the best color depth for a display mode
      • pygame.display.quit — uninitialize the display module
      • pygame.display.set_caption — set the current window caption
      • pygame.display.set_gamma — change the hardware gamma ramps
      • pygame.display.set_gamma_ramp — change the hardware gamma ramps with a custom lookup
      • pygame.display.set_icon — change the system image for the display window
      • pygame.display.set_mode — initialize a window or screen for display
      • pygame.display.set_palette — set the display color palette for indexed displays
      • pygame.display.toggle_fullscreen — switch between fullscreen and windowed displays
      • pygame.display.update — update portions of the screen for software displays
    • pygame.draw — pygame module for drawing shapes
      • pygame.draw.aaline — draw fine antialiased lines
      • pygame.draw.aalines — draw a connected sequence of antialiased lines
      • pygame.draw.arc — draw a partial section of an ellipse
      • pygame.draw.circle — draw a circle around a point
      • pygame.draw.ellipse — draw a round shape inside a rectangle
      • pygame.draw.line — draw a straight line segment
      • pygame.draw.lines — draw multiple contiguous line segments
      • pygame.draw.polygon — draw a shape with any number of sides
      • pygame.draw.rect — draw a rectangle shape
    • pygame.encode_file_path — Encode a unicode or bytes object as a file system path
    • pygame.encode_string — Encode a unicode or bytes object
    • pygame.error — standard pygame exception
    • pygame.event — pygame module for interacting with events and queues
      • pygame.event.Event — create a new event object
      • pygame.event.clear — remove all events from the queue
      • pygame.event.event_name — get the string name from and event id
      • pygame.event.get — get events from the queue
      • pygame.event.get_blocked — test if a type of event is blocked from the queue
      • pygame.event.get_grab — test if the program is sharing input devices
      • pygame.event.peek — test if event types are waiting on the queue
      • pygame.event.poll — get a single event from the queue
      • pygame.event.post — place a new event on the queue
      • pygame.event.pump — internally process pygame event handlers
      • pygame.event.set_allowed — control which events are allowed on the queue
      • pygame.event.set_blocked — control which events are allowed on the queue
      • pygame.event.set_grab — control the sharing of input devices with other applications
      • pygame.event.wait — wait for a single event from the queue
    • pygame.examples — module of example programs
      • pygame.examples.aliens.main — play the full aliens example
      • pygame.examples.arraydemo.main — show various surfarray effects
      • pygame.examples.blend_fill.main — demonstrate the various surface.fill method blend options
      • pygame.examples.blit_blends.main — uses alternative additive fill to that of surface.fill
      • pygame.examples.camera.main — display video captured live from an attached camera
      • pygame.examples.chimp.main — hit the moving chimp
      • pygame.examples.cursors.main — display two different custom cursors
      • pygame.examples.eventlist.main — display pygame events
      • pygame.examples.fastevents.main — stress test the fastevents module
      • pygame.examples.fonty.main — run a font rendering example
      • pygame.examples.glcube.main — display an animated 3D cube using OpenGL
      • pygame.examples.headless_no_windows_needed.main — write an image file that is smoothscaled copy of an input file
      • pygame.examples.liquid.main — display an animated liquid effect
      • pygame.examples.mask.main — display multiple images bounce off each other using collision detection
      • pygame.examples.midi.main — run a midi example
      • pygame.examples.moveit.main — display animated objects on the screen
      • pygame.examples.movieplayer.main — play an MPEG movie
      • pygame.examples.oldalien.main — play the original aliens example
      • pygame.examples.overlay.main — play a .pgm video using overlays
      • pygame.examples.pixelarray.main — display various pixelarray generated effects
      • pygame.examples.scaletest.main — interactively scale an image using smoothscale
      • pygame.examples.scrap_clipboard.main — access the clipboard
      • pygame.examples.scroll.main — run a Surface.scroll example that shows a magnified image
      • pygame.examples.sound.main — load and play a sound
      • pygame.examples.sound_array_demos.main — play various sndarray effects
      • pygame.examples.stars.main — run a simple starfield example
      • pygame.examples.testsprite.main — show lots of sprites moving around
      • pygame.examples.vgrade.main — display a vertical gradient
    • pygame.font — pygame module for loading and rendering fonts
      • pygame.font.Font — create a new Font object from a file
        • Font.get_ascent — get the ascent of the font
        • Font.get_bold — check if text will be rendered bold
        • Font.get_descent — get the descent of the font
        • Font.get_height — get the height of the font
        • Font.get_italic — check if the text will be rendered italic
        • Font.get_linesize — get the line space of the font text
        • Font.get_underline — check if text will be rendered with an underline
        • Font.metrics — Gets the metrics for each character in the pased string.
        • Font.render — Renders text on a surface
        • Font.set_bold — enable fake rendering of bold text
        • Font.set_italic — enable fake rendering of italic text
        • Font.set_underline — control if text is rendered with an underline
        • Font.size — determine the amount of space needed to render text
      • pygame.font.SysFont — create a Font object from the system fonts
      • pygame.font.get_default_font — get the filename of the default font
      • pygame.font.get_fonts — get all available fonts
      • pygame.font.get_init — true if the font module is initialized
      • pygame.font.init — initialize the font module
      • pygame.font.match_font — find a specific font on the system
      • pygame.font.quit — uninitialize the font module
    • pygame.freetype — Enhanced Pygame module for loading and rendering fonts
      • pygame.freetype.Font — Creates a new Font from a supported font file.
        • Font.antialiased — Font antialiasing mode
        • Font.bold — Gets or sets the font's bold style
        • Font.fixed_width — Gets whether the font is fixed-width
        • Font.get_metrics — Gets glyph metrics for the font's characters
        • Font.get_size — Gets the size of rendered text
        • Font.height — Gets the height of the Font
        • Font.italic — Gets or sets the font's italic style
        • Font.name — Gets the name of the font face.
        • Font.render — Renders text on a surface
        • Font.render_raw — Renders text as a string of bytes
        • Font.style — Gets or sets the font's style
        • Font.underline — Gets or sets the font's underline style
        • Font.vertical — Font vertical mode
      • pygame.freetype.get_error — Get the latest error
      • pygame.freetype.get_version — Get the FreeType version
      • pygame.freetype.init — Initialize the underlying FreeType 2 library.
      • pygame.freetype.quit — Shuts down the underlying FreeType 2 library.
      • pygame.freetype.was_init — Returns whether the the FreeType 2 library is initialized.
    • pygame.get_error — get the current error message
    • pygame.get_sdl_byteorder — get the byte order of SDL
    • pygame.get_sdl_version — get the version number of SDL
    • pygame.gfxdraw — pygame module for drawing shapes
      • pygame.gfxdraw.aacircle — draw an anti-aliased circle
      • pygame.gfxdraw.aaellipse — draw an anti-aliased ellipse
      • pygame.gfxdraw.aapolygon — draw an anti-aliased polygon
      • pygame.gfxdraw.aatrigon — draw an anti-aliased triangle
      • pygame.gfxdraw.arc — draw an arc
      • pygame.gfxdraw.bezier — draw a bezier curve
      • pygame.gfxdraw.box — draw a box
      • pygame.gfxdraw.circle — draw a circle
      • pygame.gfxdraw.ellipse — draw an ellipse
      • pygame.gfxdraw.filled_circle — draw a filled circle
      • pygame.gfxdraw.filled_ellipse — draw a filled ellipse
      • pygame.gfxdraw.filled_polygon — draw a filled polygon
      • pygame.gfxdraw.filled_trigon — draw a filled trigon
      • pygame.gfxdraw.hline — draw a horizontal line
      • pygame.gfxdraw.line — draw a line
      • pygame.gfxdraw.pie — draw a pie
      • pygame.gfxdraw.pixel — place a pixel
      • pygame.gfxdraw.polygon — draw a polygon
      • pygame.gfxdraw.rectangle — draw a rectangle
      • pygame.gfxdraw.textured_polygon — draw a textured polygon
      • pygame.gfxdraw.trigon — draw a triangle
      • pygame.gfxdraw.vline — draw a vertical line
    • pygame.image — pygame module for image transfer
      • pygame.image.frombuffer — create a new Surface that shares data inside a string buffer
      • pygame.image.fromstring — create new Surface from a string buffer
      • pygame.image.get_extended — test if extended image formats can be loaded
      • pygame.image.load — load new image from a file
      • pygame.image.save — save an image to disk
      • pygame.image.tostring — transfer image to string buffer
    • pygame.init — initialize all imported pygame modules
    • pygame.joystick — pygame module for interacting with joystick devices
      • pygame.joystick.Joystick — create a new Joystick object
        • Joystick.get_axis — get the current position of an axis
        • Joystick.get_ball — get the relative position of a trackball
        • Joystick.get_button — get the current button state
        • Joystick.get_hat — get the position of a joystick hat
        • Joystick.get_id — get the Joystick ID
        • Joystick.get_init — check if the Joystick is initialized
        • Joystick.get_name — get the Joystick system name
        • Joystick.get_numaxes — get the number of axes on a Joystick
        • Joystick.get_numballs — get the number of trackballs on a Joystick
        • Joystick.get_numbuttons — get the number of buttons on a Joystick
        • Joystick.get_numhats — get the number of hat controls on a Joystick
        • Joystick.init — initialize the Joystick
        • Joystick.quit — uninitialize the Joystick
      • pygame.joystick.get_count — number of joysticks on the system
      • pygame.joystick.get_init — true if the joystick module is initialized
      • pygame.joystick.init — initialize the joystick module
      • pygame.joystick.quit — uninitialize the joystick module
    • pygame.key — pygame module to work with the keyboard
      • pygame.key.get_focused — true if the display is receiving keyboard input from the system
      • pygame.key.get_mods — determine which modifier keys are being held
      • pygame.key.get_pressed — get the state of all keyboard buttons
      • pygame.key.get_repeat — see how held keys are repeated
      • pygame.key.name — get the name of a key identifier
      • pygame.key.set_mods — temporarily set which modifier keys are pressed
      • pygame.key.set_repeat — control how held keys are repeated
    • pygame.locals — pygame constants
    • pygame.mask — pygame module for image masks.
      • pygame.mask.Mask — pygame object for representing 2d bitmasks
        • Mask.angle — Returns the orientation of the pixels
        • Mask.centroid — Returns the centroid of the pixels in a Mask
        • Mask.clear — Sets all bits to 0
        • Mask.connected_component — Returns a mask of a connected region of pixels.
        • Mask.connected_components — Returns a list of masks of connected regions of pixels.
        • Mask.convolve — Return the convolution of self with another mask.
        • Mask.count — Returns the number of set pixels
        • Mask.draw — Draws a mask onto another
        • Mask.erase — Erases a mask from another
        • Mask.fill — Sets all bits to 1
        • Mask.get_at — Returns nonzero if the bit at (x,y) is set.
        • Mask.get_bounding_rects — Returns a list of bounding rects of regions of set pixels.
        • Mask.get_size — Returns the size of the mask.
        • Mask.invert — Flips the bits in a Mask
        • Mask.outline — list of points outlining an object
        • Mask.overlap — Returns the point of intersection if the masks overlap with the given offset - or None if it does not overlap.
        • Mask.overlap_area — Returns the number of overlapping 'pixels'.
        • Mask.overlap_mask — Returns a mask of the overlapping pixels
        • Mask.scale — Resizes a mask
        • Mask.set_at — Sets the position in the mask given by x and y.
      • pygame.mask.from_surface — Returns a Mask from the given surface.
      • pygame.mask.from_threshold — Creates a mask by thresholding Surfaces
    • pygame.math — pygame module for vector classes
      • pygame.math.Vector2 — a 2-Dimensional Vector
        • Vector2.angle_to — calculates the angle to a given vector in degrees.
        • Vector2.as_polar — returns a tuple with radial distance and azimuthal angle.
        • Vector2.cross — calculates the cross- or vector-product
        • Vector2.distance_squared_to — calculates the squared euclidic distance to a given vector.
        • Vector2.distance_to — calculates the euclidic distance to a given vector.
        • Vector2.dot — calculates the dot- or scalar-product with the other vector
        • Vector2.elementwise — The next operation will be performed elementwize.
        • Vector2.from_polar — Sets x and y from a polar coordinates tuple.
        • Vector2.is_normalized — tests if the vector is normalized i.e. has length == 1.
        • Vector2.length — returns the euclidic length of the vector.
        • Vector2.length_squared — returns the squared euclidic length of the vector.
        • Vector2.lerp — returns a linear interpolation to the given vector.
        • Vector2.normalize — returns a vector with the same direction but length 1.
        • Vector2.normalize_ip — normalizes the vector in place so that its length is 1.
        • Vector2.reflect — returns a vector reflected of a given normal.
        • Vector2.reflect_ip — reflect the vector of a given normal in place.
        • Vector2.rotate — rotates a vector by a given angle in degrees.
        • Vector2.rotate_ip — rotates the vector by a given angle in degrees in place.
        • Vector2.scale_to_length — scales the vector to a given length.
        • Vector2.slerp — returns a spherical interpolation to the given vector.
      • pygame.math.Vector3 — a 3-Dimensional Vector
        • Vector3.angle_to — calculates the angle to a given vector in degrees.
        • Vector3.as_spherical — returns a tuple with radial distance, inclination and azimuthal angle.
        • Vector3.cross — calculates the cross- or vector-product
        • Vector3.distance_squared_to — calculates the squared euclidic distance to a given vector.
        • Vector3.distance_to — calculates the euclidic distance to a given vector.
        • Vector3.dot — calculates the dot- or scalar-product with the other vector
        • Vector3.elementwise — The next operation will be performed elementwize.
        • Vector3.from_spherical — Sets x, y and z from a spherical coordinates 3-tuple.
        • Vector3.is_normalized — tests if the vector is normalized i.e. has length == 1.
        • Vector3.length — returns the euclidic length of the vector.
        • Vector3.length_squared — returns the squared euclidic length of the vector.
        • Vector3.lerp — returns a linear interpolation to the given vector.
        • Vector3.normalize — returns a vector with the same direction but length 1.
        • Vector3.normalize_ip — normalizes the vector in place so that its length is 1.
        • Vector3.reflect — returns a vector reflected of a given normal.
        • Vector3.reflect_ip — reflect the vector of a given normal in place.
        • Vector3.rotate — rotates a vector by a given angle in degrees.
        • Vector3.rotate_ip — rotates the vector by a given angle in degrees in place.
        • Vector3.rotate_x — rotates a vector around the x-axis by the angle in degrees.
        • Vector3.rotate_x_ip — rotates the vector around the x-axis by the angle in degrees in place.
        • Vector3.rotate_y — rotates a vector around the y-axis by the angle in degrees.
        • Vector3.rotate_y_ip — rotates the vector around the y-axis by the angle in degrees in place.
        • Vector3.rotate_z — rotates a vector around the z-axis by the angle in degrees.
        • Vector3.rotate_z_ip — rotates the vector around the z-axis by the angle in degrees in place.
        • Vector3.scale_to_length — scales the vector to a given length.
        • Vector3.slerp — returns a spherical interpolation to the given vector.
      • pygame.math.disable_swizzling — globally disables swizzling for vectors.
      • pygame.math.enable_swizzling — globally enables swizzling for vectors.
    • pygame.midi — pygame module for interacting with midi input and output.
      • pygame.midi.Input — Input is used to get midi input from midi devices.
        • Input.close — closes a midi stream, flushing any pending buffers.
        • Input.poll — returns true if there's data, or false if not.
        • Input.read — reads num_events midi events from the buffer.
      • pygame.midi.MidiException — exception that pygame.midi functions and classes can raise
      • pygame.midi.Output — Output is used to send midi to an output device
        • Output.abort — terminates outgoing messages immediately
        • Output.close — closes a midi stream, flushing any pending buffers.
        • Output.note_off — turns a midi note off. Note must be on.
        • Output.note_on — turns a midi note on. Note must be off.
        • Output.set_instrument — select an instrument, with a value between 0 and 127
        • Output.write — writes a list of midi data to the Output
        • Output.write_short — write_short(status <, data1><, data2>)
        • Output.write_sys_ex — writes a timestamped system-exclusive midi message.
      • pygame.midi.get_count — gets the number of devices.
      • pygame.midi.get_default_input_id — gets default input device number
      • pygame.midi.get_default_output_id — gets default output device number
      • pygame.midi.get_device_info — returns information about a midi device
      • pygame.midi.init — initialize the midi module
      • pygame.midi.midis2events — converts midi events to pygame events
      • pygame.midi.quit — uninitialize the midi module
      • pygame.midi.time — returns the current time in ms of the PortMidi timer
    • pygame.mixer — pygame module for loading and playing sounds
      • pygame.mixer.Channel — Create a Channel object for controlling playback
        • Channel.fadeout — stop playback after fading channel out
        • Channel.get_busy — check if the channel is active
        • Channel.get_endevent — get the event a channel sends when playback stops
        • Channel.get_queue — return any Sound that is queued
        • Channel.get_sound — get the currently playing Sound
        • Channel.get_volume — get the volume of the playing channel
        • Channel.pause — temporarily stop playback of a channel
        • Channel.play — play a Sound on a specific Channel
        • Channel.queue — queue a Sound object to follow the current
        • Channel.set_endevent — have the channel send an event when playback stops
        • Channel.set_volume — set the volume of a playing channel
        • Channel.stop — stop playback on a Channel
        • Channel.unpause — resume pause playback of a channel
      • pygame.mixer.Sound — Create a new Sound object from a file or buffer object
        • Sound.fadeout — stop sound playback after fading out
        • Sound.get_buffer — acquires a buffer object for the samples of the Sound.
        • Sound.get_length — get the length of the Sound
        • Sound.get_num_channels — count how many times this Sound is playing
        • Sound.get_volume — get the playback volume
        • Sound.play — begin sound playback
        • Sound.set_volume — set the playback volume for this Sound
        • Sound.stop — stop sound playback
      • pygame.mixer.fadeout — fade out the volume on all sounds before stopping
      • pygame.mixer.find_channel — find an unused channel
      • pygame.mixer.get_busy — test if any sound is being mixed
      • pygame.mixer.get_init — test if the mixer is initialized
      • pygame.mixer.get_num_channels — get the total number of playback channels
      • pygame.mixer.init — initialize the mixer module
      • pygame.mixer.music — pygame module for controlling streamed audio
        • pygame.mixer.music.fadeout — stop music playback after fading out
        • pygame.mixer.music.get_busy — check if the music stream is playing
        • pygame.mixer.music.get_endevent — get the event a channel sends when playback stops
        • pygame.mixer.music.get_pos — get the music play time
        • pygame.mixer.music.get_volume — get the music volume
        • pygame.mixer.music.load — Load a music file for playback
        • pygame.mixer.music.pause — temporarily stop music playback
        • pygame.mixer.music.play — Start the playback of the music stream
        • pygame.mixer.music.queue — queue a music file to follow the current
        • pygame.mixer.music.rewind — restart music
        • pygame.mixer.music.set_endevent — have the music send an event when playback stops
        • pygame.mixer.music.set_pos — set position to play from
        • pygame.mixer.music.set_volume — set the music volume
        • pygame.mixer.music.stop — stop the music playback
        • pygame.mixer.music.unpause — resume paused music
      • pygame.mixer.pause — temporarily stop playback of all sound channels
      • pygame.mixer.pre_init — preset the mixer init arguments
      • pygame.mixer.quit — uninitialize the mixer
      • pygame.mixer.set_num_channels — set the total number of playback channels
      • pygame.mixer.set_reserved — reserve channels from being automatically used
      • pygame.mixer.stop — stop playback of all sound channels
      • pygame.mixer.unpause — resume paused playback of sound channels
    • pygame.mouse — pygame module to work with the mouse
      • pygame.mouse.get_cursor — get the image for the system mouse cursor
      • pygame.mouse.get_focused — check if the display is receiving mouse input
      • pygame.mouse.get_pos — get the mouse cursor position
      • pygame.mouse.get_pressed — get the state of the mouse buttons
      • pygame.mouse.get_rel — get the amount of mouse movement
      • pygame.mouse.set_cursor — set the image for the system mouse cursor
      • pygame.mouse.set_pos — set the mouse cursor position
      • pygame.mouse.set_visible — hide or show the mouse cursor
    • pygame.movie — pygame module for playback of mpeg video
      • pygame.movie.Movie — load an mpeg movie file
        • Movie.get_busy — check if the movie is currently playing
        • Movie.get_frame — get the current video frame
        • Movie.get_length — the total length of the movie in seconds
        • Movie.get_size — get the resolution of the video
        • Movie.get_time — get the current vide playback time
        • Movie.has_audio — check if the movie file contains audio
        • Movie.has_video — check if the movie file contains video
        • Movie.pause — temporarily stop and resume playback
        • Movie.play — start playback of a movie
        • Movie.render_frame — set the current video frame
        • Movie.rewind — restart the movie playback
        • Movie.set_display — set the video target Surface
        • Movie.set_volume — set the audio playback volume
        • Movie.skip — advance the movie playback position
        • Movie.stop — stop movie playback
    • pygame.pixelcopy — pygame module for general pixel array copying
      • pygame.pixelcopy.array_to_surface — copy an array object to a surface
      • pygame.pixelcopy.map_array — copy an array to another array, using surface format
      • pygame.pixelcopy.surface_to_array — copy surface pixels to an array object
    • pygame.quit — uninitialize all pygame modules
    • pygame.register_quit — register a function to be called when pygame quits
    • pygame.scrap — pygame module for clipboard support.
      • pygame.scrap.contains — Checks, whether a certain type is available in the clipboard.
      • pygame.scrap.get — Gets the data for the specified type from the clipboard.
      • pygame.scrap.get_types — Gets a list of the available clipboard types.
      • pygame.scrap.init — Initializes the scrap module.
      • pygame.scrap.lost — Checks whether the clipboard is currently owned by the application.
      • pygame.scrap.put — Places data into the clipboard.
      • pygame.scrap.set_mode — Sets the clipboard access mode.
    • pygame.set_error — set the current error message
    • pygame.sndarray — pygame module for accessing sound sample data
      • pygame.sndarray.array — copy Sound samples into an array
      • pygame.sndarray.get_arraytype — Gets the currently active array type.
      • pygame.sndarray.get_arraytypes — Gets the array system types currently supported.
      • pygame.sndarray.make_sound — convert an array into a Sound object
      • pygame.sndarray.samples — reference Sound samples into an array
      • pygame.sndarray.use_arraytype — Sets the array system to be used for sound arrays
    • pygame.sprite — pygame module with basic game object classes
      • pygame.sprite.DirtySprite — a more featureful subclass of Sprite with more attributes
      • pygame.sprite.Group — container class for many Sprites
        • Group.add — add Sprites to this Group
        • Group.clear — draw a background over the Sprites
        • Group.copy — duplicate the Group
        • Group.draw — blit the Sprite images
        • Group.empty — remove all Sprites
        • Group.has — test if a Group contains Sprites
        • Group.remove — remove Sprites from the Group
        • Group.sprites — list of the Sprites this Group contains
        • Group.update — call the update method on contained Sprites
      • pygame.sprite.GroupSingle — Group container that holds a single Sprite
      • pygame.sprite.LayeredDirty — LayeredDirty Group is for DirtySprites. Subclasses LayeredUpdates.
        • LayeredDirty.change_layer — changes the layer of the sprite
        • LayeredDirty.clear — used to set background
        • LayeredDirty.draw — draw all sprites in the right order onto the passed surface.
        • LayeredDirty.get_clip — clip the area where to draw. Just pass None (default) to reset the clip
        • LayeredDirty.repaint_rect — repaints the given area
        • LayeredDirty.set_clip — clip the area where to draw. Just pass None (default) to reset the clip
        • LayeredDirty.set_timing_treshold — sets the treshold in milliseconds
      • pygame.sprite.LayeredUpdates — LayeredUpdates Group handles layers, that draws like OrderedUpdates.
        • LayeredUpdates.add — add a sprite or sequence of sprites to a group
        • LayeredUpdates.change_layer — changes the layer of the sprite
        • LayeredUpdates.draw — draw all sprites in the right order onto the passed surface.
        • LayeredUpdates.get_bottom_layer — returns the bottom layer
        • LayeredUpdates.get_layer_of_sprite — returns the layer that sprite is currently in.
        • LayeredUpdates.get_sprite — returns the sprite at the index idx from the groups sprites
        • LayeredUpdates.get_sprites_at — returns a list with all sprites at that position.
        • LayeredUpdates.get_sprites_from_layer — returns all sprites from a layer, ordered by how they where added
        • LayeredUpdates.get_top_layer — returns the top layer
        • LayeredUpdates.get_top_sprite — returns the topmost sprite
        • LayeredUpdates.layers — returns a list of layers defined (unique), sorted from botton up.
        • LayeredUpdates.move_to_back — moves the sprite to the bottom layer
        • LayeredUpdates.move_to_front — brings the sprite to front layer
        • LayeredUpdates.remove_sprites_of_layer — removes all sprites from a layer and returns them as a list.
        • LayeredUpdates.sprites — returns a ordered list of sprites (first back, last top).
        • LayeredUpdates.switch_layer — switches the sprites from layer1 to layer2
      • pygame.sprite.OrderedUpdates — RenderUpdates class that draws Sprites in order of addition
      • pygame.sprite.RenderUpdates — Group class that tracks dirty updates
        • RenderUpdates.draw — blit the Sprite images and track changed areas
      • pygame.sprite.Sprite — simple base class for visible game objects
        • Sprite.add — add the sprite to groups
        • Sprite.alive — does the sprite belong to any groups
        • Sprite.groups — list of Groups that contain this Sprite
        • Sprite.kill — remove the Sprite from all Groups
        • Sprite.remove — remove the sprite from groups
        • Sprite.update — method to control sprite behavior
      • pygame.sprite.collide_circle — collision detection between two sprites, using circles.
      • pygame.sprite.collide_circle_ratio — collision detection between two sprites, using circles scaled to a ratio.
      • pygame.sprite.collide_mask — collision detection between two sprites, using masks.
      • pygame.sprite.collide_rect — collision detection between two sprites, using rects.
      • pygame.sprite.collide_rect_ratio — collision detection between two sprites, using rects scaled to a ratio.
      • pygame.sprite.groupcollide — find all Sprites that collide between two Groups
      • pygame.sprite.spritecollide — find Sprites in a Group that intersect another Sprite
      • pygame.sprite.spritecollideany — simple test if a Sprite intersects anything in a Group
    • pygame.surfarray — pygame module for accessing surface pixel data using array interfaces
      • pygame.surfarray.array2d — Copy pixels into a 2d array
      • pygame.surfarray.array3d — Copy pixels into a 3d array
      • pygame.surfarray.array_alpha — Copy pixel alphas into a 2d array
      • pygame.surfarray.array_colorkey — Copy the colorkey values into a 2d array
      • pygame.surfarray.blit_array — Blit directly from a array values
      • pygame.surfarray.get_arraytype — Gets the currently active array type.
      • pygame.surfarray.get_arraytypes — Gets the array system types currently supported.
      • pygame.surfarray.make_surface — Copy an array to a new surface
      • pygame.surfarray.map_array — Map a 3d array into a 2d array
      • pygame.surfarray.pixels2d — Reference pixels into a 2d array
      • pygame.surfarray.pixels3d — Reference pixels into a 3d array
      • pygame.surfarray.pixels_alpha — Reference pixel alphas into a 2d array
      • pygame.surfarray.pixels_blue — Reference pixel blue into a 2d array.
      • pygame.surfarray.pixels_green — Reference pixel green into a 2d array.
      • pygame.surfarray.pixels_red — Reference pixel red into a 2d array.
      • pygame.surfarray.use_arraytype — Sets the array system to be used for surface arrays
    • pygame.tests — Pygame unit test suite package
      • pygame.tests.run — Run the Pygame unit test suite
    • pygame.time — pygame module for monitoring time
      • pygame.time.Clock — create an object to help track time
        • Clock.get_fps — compute the clock framerate
        • Clock.get_rawtime — actual time used in the previous tick
        • Clock.get_time — time used in the previous tick
        • Clock.tick — update the clock
        • Clock.tick_busy_loop — update the clock
      • pygame.time.delay — pause the program for an amount of time
      • pygame.time.get_ticks — get the time in milliseconds
      • pygame.time.set_timer — repeatedly create an event on the event queue
      • pygame.time.wait — pause the program for an amount of time
    • pygame.transform — pygame module to transform surfaces
      • pygame.transform.average_color — finds the average color of a surface
      • pygame.transform.average_surfaces — find the average surface from many surfaces.
      • pygame.transform.chop — gets a copy of an image with an interior area removed
      • pygame.transform.flip — flip vertically and horizontally
      • pygame.transform.get_smoothscale_backend — return smoothscale filter version in use: 'GENERIC', 'MMX', or 'SSE'
      • pygame.transform.laplacian — find edges in a surface
      • pygame.transform.rotate — rotate an image
      • pygame.transform.rotozoom — filtered scale and rotation
      • pygame.transform.scale — resize to new resolution
      • pygame.transform.scale2x — specialized image doubler
      • pygame.transform.set_smoothscale_backend — set smoothscale filter version to one of: 'GENERIC', 'MMX', or 'SSE'
      • pygame.transform.smoothscale — scale a surface to an arbitrary size smoothly
      • pygame.transform.threshold — finds which, and how many pixels in a surface are within a threshold of a color.
    • pygame.version — small module containing version information
      • pygame.version.ver — version number as a string
      • pygame.version.vernum — tupled integers of the version
